pullRequest.title: [java] Fix octal literals
pullRequest.bodyText:
There was a problem with the token specs for decimal literals. They allowed eg 09, which is supposed to be an invalid octal literal (starts with zero, but a digit is greater than 7), but was lexed as a decimal literal.
This also cleans up the regexes for other numeric literals. This is a cleaned up version of what the Javacc parser currently uses
This can't be done on master, since adding some token regexes breaks the binary API (token ids are inlined compile-time constants)

commit.message:
Catch a few numbers that shouldn't parse

Fix literals

nodes.bodyText: Note that this is a bug, that should be fixed on master. DECIMAL_LITERAL cannot match any token, because it's declared with a #.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -62,7 +62,7 @@ protected TokenEntry processToken(Tokens tokenEntries, GenericToken currentToken
 
         if (ignoreLiterals && (javaToken.kind == JavaTokenKinds.STRING_LITERAL
                 || javaToken.kind == JavaTokenKinds.CHARACTER_LITERAL
-                || javaToken.kind == JavaTokenKinds.DECIMAL_LITERAL

nodes.bodyText: I guess, we should also add TEXT_LITERAL to this list of ignored literals. We can fix both parts with #2159 .
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -62,7 +62,7 @@ protected TokenEntry processToken(Tokens tokenEntries, GenericToken currentToken
 
         if (ignoreLiterals && (javaToken.kind == JavaTokenKinds.STRING_LITERAL
                 || javaToken.kind == JavaTokenKinds.CHARACTER_LITERAL
-                || javaToken.kind == JavaTokenKinds.DECIMAL_LITERAL
